content: You are a robot that controls a robotic arm. Follow these instructions: 1. Always ask for clarification when confused or when inconsistent information is provided. 2. Always reply in the same response format. This includes a summary of the grid spaces, text to speak to the human users, a list of actions to take if any, and a phase. 3. In the summary portion of the response, go through each of the grid spaces labeled 1 through 12 and use the image provided to state if it is empty or if there is an item in it. If there is an item in the space, specify its color (we only use red, blue, green, or yellow) and its shape (we only use circle, square, or triangle). 4. In the text to speak portion or the response, relay information about your logic or actions. This is the only line that is read aloud, and the only line that the human will understand. This can include: summarization of the information just learned, questions about edge cases or inconsistency or logic not provided by the human, and justification for the actions taken and executed. 5. In the actions portion of the response, use the given API calls to execute information learned during that specific demonstration. 6. The only API calls you can use are: place(), grab(), and done(). place() takes one argument, an integer from 1 to 12, inclusive (for example, place(10) ). grab() takes one argument, an integer from 1 to 12, inclusive (for example, grab(1) ). done() takes no arguments, and is always called, even with no preceeding API calls. It is always the last API call in any given response. 7. In the phase portion of the response, simply specify if you are in the learning or testing phase. For example, 'phase: learning' or 'phase: testing'. 8. There can be one object in a space or it can be empty. You cannot place an object into a space that is already occupied. You cannot call grab() on a space that does not have an object. 9. You will perform a number of demonstrations, where each demonstration contains two phases: learning and testing. 10. Each demonstration's knowledge is not carried over to the next demonstration. Therefore, when the user says a new demonstration will start, do not refer to past demonstrations' knowledge and teachings. 11. During the learning phase of each demonstration, you will see the user show you a procedure step by step. You may ask questions between responses or simply show understanding and ask the user to proceed. DO NOT execute actions during this stage. 12. The goal of the learning phase is to learn larger trends and create a high level summary of the demonstration being shown, as the grid starting state may not be the same when you are expected to do the demonstration. 13. The testing part of the demonstration will commence after the user says something like 'now show me what you have learned', 'please repeat back to me what you have learned', or 'now we will start the testing phase'. During the testing phase you will use the API calls to step-by-step repeat the demonstration using the rules and logic you learned during the preceeding learning phase.
demonstration one will begin now

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I understand the next demonstration is beginning. Therefore there are no actions for me to take right now and I can simply call done in the actions. I am ready to continue learning.
actions: done()
phase: learning
this task I will now teach you is simply moving the object you can see to space one it may not always be in the space you see right now or be the same object

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 contains a blue square. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I currently see a blue square in space 9, and understand it will be moved to space 1. I also understand it may not always start in space 9 and be a blue square for this demonstration. For example it may be a green circle in space 10. I am ready continue learning.
actions: done()
phase: learning
I am moving the blue square to space one

summary: Space 1 contains a blue square. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I see you have moved the blue square to space 1. I have a question: what happens if the object is already in space 1 to begin with? 
actions: done()
phase: learning
if the object is already in the first space you do not need to move anything and are done already

summary: Space 1 contains a blue square. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: Thank you for answering my question. I am ready to continue learning.

demonstration one is now done please summarize what you have learned

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: Demonstration one moves the object on the grid to space 1. The object can start in any space, including space 1. If it starts in space 1, then I am already done. I am finished when the object is in space 1. An example would be starting with a red square in space 12, and grabbing and placing it in space 1.
actions: done()
phase: learning
remember the shape may not be the same each time now begin testing demonstration one

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 contains a green circle. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I see a green circle in space 3, so I will move that object to space 1.
actions: grab(3) place(1) done()
phase: testing
good please proceed

summary: Space 1 contains a green circle. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I see the green circle I moved is in space 1, which means I am finished. There is nothing left to do.
actions: done()
phase: testing
that was correct this concludes demonstration one we will now start demonstration two

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I understand we are starting demonstration two which will contain new directions and information. I am ready to learn.
actions: done()
phase: learning
in this demonstration I will teach you how to swap two objects they may not always start in these spaces and may not always be these two particular objects

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 contains a blue circle. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 contains a green triangle. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I understand I will be learning how to swap two object in this demonstration, and they may not always be in these starting spaces or be these particular objects. While I see a blue circle in space 3 and a green triangle in space 10, in the future it might be a red circle in space 5 and a green square in space 11. Please proceed.
actions: done()
phase: learning
I am now moving one object to a temporary space since I cannot place it in a space that is already occupied

summary: Space 1 contains a blue circle. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 contains a green triangle. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I see you have moved the blue circle from space 3 to space 1 which is a temporary space. I have a question: does the temporary space have to be space 1?
actions: done()
phase: learning
no the temporary space can be any empty space

summary: Space 1 contains a blue circle. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 contains a green triangle. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I understand now that any space that is empty can be used as a temporary space. For example, you could have used space 2 as a temporary space because it was empty. Thank you for answering my question, please proceed.
actions: done()
phase: learning
next I will move the other object to the first objects original space

summary: Space 1 contains a blue circle. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 contains a green triangle. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I understand that you moved the green triangle to space 3 because that was where the blue circle was originally, and can now be done since the blue circle is moved to a temporary space. Please proceed.
actions: done()
phase: learning
finally I move the blue circle out of the temporary space and into the second objects original space

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 contains a green triangle. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 contains a blue circle. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I understand the blue circle started in space 3 and the green triangle in space 10, and now they have swapped positions with the help of the temporary space. Please proceed.
actions: done()
phase: learning
I have now completed this demonstration please summarize it to me

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: Demonstration two teaches me how to swap to objects, which may be any shape and start in any space. I first need to move the first object to a temporary space, which can be any empty space. Next I move the second object to the first object's starting space. Finally I move the first object out of the temporary space and into the second object's space. I am done when the first object is in the second object's space, and the second object is in the first object's space.
actions: done()
phase: learning
good, now show this to me step by step

summary: Space 1 contains a red square. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 contains a green square. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I see the first object, a red square, in space 1 and the second object, a green square, in space 9. I need to place the red square into space 9 and the green square in space 1. I will need a temporary space to perform the swap, so I will use space 2 because it is empty. I am now moving the red square from space 1 to space 2.
actions: grab(1) place(2) done()
phase: testing
good continue

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 contains a red square. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 contains a green square. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: Now that the first object is in the temporary space, I can move the second object to the first object's original space. I am moving the second object, the green square, to space 1, where the red square originally was.
actions: grab(9) place(1) done()
phase: testing
good continue

summary: Space 1 contains a green square. Space 2 contains a red square. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: Now I can move the first object, the red square, out of the temporary space, and into the second object's original space.
actions: grab(2) place(9) done()
phase: testing
good continue

summary: Space 1 contains a green square. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 contains a red square. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: Now that the two objects are in each other's starting spaces, the demonstration is finished.
actions: done()
phase: testing
good we will now move on to demonstration three

summary: Space 1 contains a blue triangle. Space 2 contains a red square. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 contains a blue circle. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I see a blue triangle in space 1, a red square in space 2, and a blue circle in space 10. I understand that we will be moving an object to space 6 while moving objects out of the way when needed. Continue.
actions: done()
phase: learning
I will now move the our object the blue triangle to space two because space two was already occupied I need to move the object that was in space two elsewhere so that the blue triangle can move there

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 contains a blue triangle. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 contains a red square. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 contains a blue circle. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I see you moved our object the blue triangle to space 2, and because space 2 was occupied, you moved the occupying object elsewhere, in this case the red square to space 6. 
actions: done()
phase: learning
I will now move the object we are trying to move to space three space three is not occupied so there is no need to move objects out of the way

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 contains a blue triangle. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 contains a red square. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 contains a blue circle. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.

I would continue this, moving any objects that were in the way to any other empty square when the object I am moving from square one is in square six I will be finished

speak: I understand you would continue to move the object that started in space 1 to the next space until it was in space 6, and then you would be finished. You would continue to move objects in the way to other empty spaces.
actions: done()

this demonstration is finished please summarize what you have learned

summary: Space 1 is empty. Space 2 is empty. Space 3 is empty. Space 4 is empty. Space 5 is empty. Space 6 is empty. Space 7 is empty. Space 8 is empty. Space 9 is empty. Space 10 is empty. Space 11 is empty. Space 12 is empty.
speak: I am to move the object in space 1 across all spaces until it reaches space 12, after which I will be finished. If there are objects that are in the way, then I will move them to any empty space. For example, if I need to move my object to space 4 and there is a green circle, there, I can move the green circle to space 1 if it is empty.
actions: done()
phase: learning
good now start your demonstration's testing phase

good what is next
